definition: to blurt sth out/to open one's mouth without thinking
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
variant of 信口開河|信口开河[xin4 kou3 kai1 he2]

sentences.english: Don't take his words as he is talking through his hat.
sentences.chinese: 因为他信口雌黄所以不采取他的话。

sentences.english: Could you take a message for her, please?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能替我给她留信口信？

sentences.english: Don't spout off at the mouth about how the story is dumb.
sentences.chinese: 不要信口开河地评论他的需求是多么的愚蠢。

sentences.english: The old sailor love to spin yarn about his life at sea.
sentences.chinese: 那老水手爱信口开河地讲他的航海生涯。

sentences.english: You lay there on the bed, leaking, and I comforted you.
sentences.chinese: 你躺在床上，信口开河，我安慰你。

sentences.english: If there is no such thing, and who is irresponsible remarks?
sentences.chinese: 如果没有这回事，是谁在信口雌黄？

sentences.english: Don't talk for too long or ramble. Two minutes is the absolute max.
sentences.chinese: 不要讲太长时间或信口漫谈，时长最多不超过2分钟。

sentences.english: One day I went so far as to say that she is having five hundred affairs every day.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我居然信口雌黄，说她每天跟五百个人上床。

sentences.english: He made irresponsible remarks at random, regardless of the consequences.
sentences.chinese: 他不顾后果，而信口雌黄。

sentences.english: Eventually, after months of lies and irrationality, people begin disliking her.
sentences.chinese: 信口雌黄数月后，大家开始不喜欢她。

sentences.english: Speaking without thinking is shooting without aiming.
sentences.chinese: 不经思考信口雌黄，就像没有瞄准放枪。

sentences.english: Online gossip can be damaging even if provably false.
sentences.chinese: 在线八卦即使是信口胡言，也会给人带来很大的伤害。

sentences.english: He spoke offhandedly, making it clear I had no say in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 他信口开河，明显表示这件事我无权发言。

sentences.english: Fritz is loud mouth who can not be trusted with secrets.
sentences.chinese: 费瑞兹是一个信口开河的人，不能把机密告诉他。

sentences.english: Not having a good excuse for being late, she made up one.
sentences.chinese: 迟到没借口，她就信口胡编了一个。

sentences.english: She never thinks before she speaks. She just shoots from the hip.
sentences.chinese: 她说话总是不经大脑就信口开河。

definition: to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
to make up (a story)/Taiwan pr. [zou1]
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
(speak) without thinking the matter through
to boast wildly
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to tell a lie
to chatter/nonsense/blather
crazy talk/ravings/nonsense
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions/also written 振振有詞|振振有词
(idiom) half true and half false
